themes.rationale: The inscription records a formal oath (horkos) and mutual defense obligations between Athens and the people of Aphytis.

rationale: This document is an Athenian decree dating to approximately 426/5 BCE. It concerns the city of Aphytis on the Pallene peninsula. The decree regulates the importation of grain (medimnoi), establishes a mutual defense oath between the Aphytians and Athenian colonists at Potidaea, and honors the Aphytians for their continued loyalty to Athens. The mention of Methone and Thrambe highlights the strategic importance of the Chalcidice region during the Peloponnesian War.
